p: Profiles in infants with congenital CNS abnormalities and healthy infants born to ZIKV-infected mothers were analyzed next ( Figure 3A). Surprisingly, only 3 immune mediators—IL-18, IP-10, and HGF—showed a significant difference between the 2 groups ( Figure 3B). Infants with congenital CNS deformities have higher levels of IL-18 and IP-10 but much lower levels of HGF than healthy infants without any specific clinical outcomes ( Figure 3B). This is the first observation showing a differential up- and down-regulation of immune mediators in infants born to ZIKV-infected mothers.
